intro: Eremogone ferrisiae, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that bloom in early spring. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water. Eremogone ferrisiae plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing food for native pollinators.
